# Question 1

```{r echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE, results = 'hide'}
library(ggplot2)
library(mosaic)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(MASS)
library(stringr)
n_trade = 2021
n_flagged = 70
num_sim = 100000
expected_prob = 0.024

observed_counts = c(flagged = 70, not_flagged = (n_trade-n_flagged))
expected_counts = c(flagged = (expected_prob * n_trade), not_flagged = ((1-expected_prob) * n_trade))
tibble(observed = observed_counts, expected = expected_counts)

chi_squared_statistic = function(observed, expected) {
  sum((observed - expected)^2 / expected)
}

chi_sim = do(num_sim) * {
  simulated_flagged = nflip(n_trade, expected_prob) 
  simulated_counts = c(flagged = simulated_flagged, not_flagged = n_trade - simulated_flagged)
  chi_squared_statistic(simulated_counts, expected_counts)
}
ggplot(chi_sim) +
  geom_histogram(aes(x=result), bins = 55, fill = '#BF5700', color = "#F5F5DC") +
  labs(title = "Histogram of Simulated Chi-Squared Statistics", 
      x = "Chi-Squared Statistic", 
      y = "Frequency")
my_chi2 = chi_squared_statistic(observed_counts, expected_counts)
my_chi2
p_value = mean(chi_sim >= my_chi2)
p_value 
```

# Question 2
```{r echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE, results = 'hide'}
inspections = 50
n_fail = 8
p_fail = 0.03
num_sim = 100000


observed_counts = c(failed = n_fail, pass = inspections - n_fail)
expected_counts = c(failed = .03 * 50, passed = (.97) * 50)
tibble(observed = observed_counts, expected = expected_counts)

chi_squared_statistic = function(observed, expected) {
  sum((observed - expected)^2 / expected)
}

chi_sim = do(num_sim)*{
  simulated_failures <- rbinom(1, inspections, p_fail)
  simulated_passes <- inspections - simulated_failures  
  simulated_counts <- c(failed = simulated_failures, pass = simulated_passes)
  this_chi1 <- chi_squared_statistic(simulated_counts, expected_counts)
    c(chi1 = this_chi1)
}
ggplot(chi_sim) + 
  geom_histogram(aes(x=chi1), bins = 55, fill = "#F74902", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Histogram of Simulated Chi-Squared Statistics", 
      x = "Chi-Squared Statistic", 
      y = "Frequency")

my_chi2 = chi_squared_statistic(observed_counts, expected_counts)
my_chi2
p_value = mean(chi_sim >= my_chi2)
p_value 
```

# Question 4
## Part A
```{r echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE}

letter_frequencies <- read.csv("letter_frequencies.csv")
sentences <- readLines("brown_sentences.txt")


letter_frequencies$Probability <- letter_frequencies$Probability / sum(letter_frequencies$Probability)


process_text <- function(line) {
  clean_text <- gsub("[^A-Za-z]", "", line) # Remove non-letters
  clean_text <- toupper(clean_text) # Convert to uppercase
  letter_counts <- table(factor(str_split(clean_text, "")[[1]], levels = LETTERS)) # Ensure all letters exist
  return(as.list(letter_counts))
}

letter_counts_list <- lapply(sentences, process_text)


calculate_expected_counts <- function(observed_counts, freq_table) {
  total_letters <- sum(unlist(observed_counts), na.rm = TRUE)
  expected_counts <- total_letters * freq_table$Probability 

 
  expected_tibble <- tibble(Letter = freq_table$Letter, Expected_Count = expected_counts)
  return(expected_tibble)
}


calculate_chi_squared <- function(observed_counts, freq_table) {
  expected_counts <- calculate_expected_counts(observed_counts, freq_table)
  
  observed_vector <- unlist(observed_counts)  
  expected_vector <- expected_counts$Expected_Count  

  # Compute Chi-Squared Statistic
  chi_squared_stat <- sum((observed_vector - expected_vector)^2 / expected_vector, na.rm = TRUE)
  return(chi_squared_stat)
}

# Compute Chi-Squared values for all sentences
chi_squared_values <- sapply(letter_counts_list, calculate_chi_squared, letter_frequencies)

# Create a histogram of Chi-Squared values
chi_squared_df <- tibble(Chi_Squared = chi_squared_values)
chi_squared_df <- tibble(Chi_Squared = chi_squared_values)

ggplot(chi_squared_df, aes(x = Chi_Squared)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 50, fill = "#4A90E2", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Chi-Squared Statistics for Brown Sentences",
       x = "Chi-Squared Statistic",
       y = "Frequency")
```

## Part B
```{r echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE}
test_sentences <- c(
  "She opened the book and started to read the first chapter, eagerly anticipating what might come next.",
  "Despite the heavy rain, they decided to go for a long walk in the park, crossing the main avenue by the fountain in the center.",
  "The museum’s new exhibit features ancient artifacts from various civilizations around the world.",
  "He carefully examined the document, looking for any clues that might help solve the mystery.",
  "The students gathered in the auditorium to listen to the guest speaker’s inspiring lecture.",
  "Feeling vexed after an arduous and zany day at work, she hoped for a peaceful and quiet evening at home, cozying up after a quick dinner with some TV, or maybe a book on her upcoming visit to Auckland.",
  "The chef demonstrated how to prepare a delicious meal using only locally sourced ingredients, focusing mainly on some excellent dinner recipes from Spain.",
  "They watched the sunset from the hilltop, marveling at the beautiful array of colors in the sky.",
  "The committee reviewed the proposal and provided many points of useful feedback to improve the project’s effectiveness.",
  "Despite the challenges faced during the project, the team worked tirelessly to ensure its successful completion, resulting in a product that exceeded everyone’s expectations."
)
test_chi_squared_values <- sapply(test_sentences, function(sentence) {
  observed_counts <- process_text(sentence)  # Get observed letter counts
  calculate_chi_squared(observed_counts, letter_frequencies)  # Calculate chi-squared value
})

# Calculate p-values by comparing with the Brown Corpus chi-squared values
p_values <- sapply(test_chi_squared_values, function(x) mean(chi_squared_values >= x))

# Create a tibble with the results
test_results <- tibble(Sentence = 1:10, 
                       Chi_Squared_Value = test_chi_squared_values, 
                       P_Value = round(p_values, 3))
# Print the results
print(test_results)
```
